title: Current density - J-of-x for rectangular bar

content.question: A long, conducting bar is shown in the figure. The width <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>W</mi></math> and thickness <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math> of the bar are uniform, as shown in the cross section view. The bar’s conductivity varies along the width of the bar which creates a current density in the bar that varies across the bar’s width, but not across its thickness. The current density in the cross section of the bar at <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> is <math alttext="J of x, equals J sub 0, end sub, times, open parenthesis, the fraction x over W, close parenthesis, cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>J</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mi>W</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>3</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> is the distance from the left edge of the bar and <math alttext="J sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is a constant. What is the total current in the bar?

choices.label: <math alttext="one eighth J sub 0, end sub, times W T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>W</mi><mi>T</mi></math>
<math alttext="one fourth J sub 0, end sub, times W T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>W</mi><mi>T</mi></math>
<math alttext="one half J sub 0, end sub, times W T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>W</mi><mi>T</mi></math>
<math alttext="J sub 0, end sub, times W T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>W</mi><mi>T</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one fourth J sub 0, end sub, times W T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>W</mi><mi>T</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
